channel.title: No players in the area; kill all npcs
channel.description:
How would i make it so if there is no one in a certain area, all the npcs within that area are killed
I know how to declare the area they are in, the same way mutli areas are declared but im not sure how to make it so all the npcs are killed if no one is in the area (PI)

item.title: No players in the area; kill all npcs
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Oh i see thanks for clearing it up!

Read full topic
item.source: No players in the area; kill all npcs

item.title: No players in the area; kill all npcs
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:5, topic:387286”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=483089.msg3538073#msg3538073 date=1300664012]

for (Player player : PlayerHandler.players) { if (player == null) { continue; } else if (isWithinArea(player)) { return; } } for (NPC npc : NPCHandler.npcs) { if (npc != null) { npc.isDead = true; } }

public boolean isWithinArea(Player player) { return (player.absX >= ####) && (player.absX <= ####) && (player.absY >= ####) && (player.absY <= ####); }
[/quote]
Hm thanks, ill look it through, though i never understood what null meant, what does it mean?

Edit:
By reading that, i thought it through, null means yes correct?[/quote]

‘Null’ is the default value for any object. If a player’s or npc’s object is equal to ‘null’, then they don’t exist (I.E. they aren’t on the server). The null checking is just to avoid exception throwing.

Read full topic
item.source: No players in the area; kill all npcs

item.title: No players in the area; kill all npcs
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Create an event that runs every 30 seconds, loop through all the players, count how many are in the area, if 0 then loop through the npcs and kill the ones in that area.

Read full topic
